decks.notes: This Grixis Control deck focuses on efficient removal, card advantage, and powerful finishers in the form of creatures like Olivia Voldaren and Wurmcoil Engine. The deck aims to control the game through counter spells and removal until it can drop a threat that takes over the game. With a mix of direct damage, board wipes, and powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent to secure the win.

This deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence with efficient creature drops such as Birds of Paradise, Blade Splicer, and Hero of Bladehold. The deck also incorporates powerful support cards like Oblivion Ring and Gavony Township to help maintain control. The inclusion of Geist-Honored Monk and Mikaeus, the Lunarch provides additional threats and buffs for the team. Elspeth Tirel and Garruk Relentless offer versatile options for creating more creatures or removal. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of aggressive creatures and pump effects.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle using creatures with powerful abilities and synergies, backed up by support cards to increase their effectiveness. The deck aims to quickly generate and maintain a board presence by playing efficient creatures like Birds of Paradise and Hero of Bladehold, while also utilizing pump spells like Overrun to finish off the opponent. Additionally, cards like Oblivion Ring provide removal options, while planeswalkers like Elspeth Tirel and Garruk Relentless offer additional utility and threat potential.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly swarm the battlefield with powerful creatures such as Mirran Crusader and Hero of Bladehold, supported by mana ramp from cards like Birds of Paradise and Avacyn's Pilgrim. The inclusion of cards like Mikaeus, the Lunarch and Gavony Township allows for buffs and counters to further strengthen the board presence. The deck also includes removal options like Oblivion Ring and Mortarpod. The end goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast, aggressive strategy while also having options for late-game finishers like Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite and Overrun.

This deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with efficient creature threats while utilizing mana ramp to accelerate into powerful mid-game plays. The key strategy is to establish early dominance with efficient creatures like Birds of Paradise and Mirran Crusader, then use cards like Gavony Township and Elspeth Tirel to buff and protect them. The inclusion of Day of Judgment and Oblivion Ring provides options for clearing the board and dealing with opponent threats, while cards like Sword of War and Peace and Mortarpod offer additional ways to close out the game.

The main concept of the deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence with aggressive creatures such as Blade Splicer, Hero of Bladehold, Mirran Crusader, and Geist-Honored Monk. The deck also includes mana acceleration through Birds of Paradise and Avacyn's Pilgrim to quickly play these creatures. The deck also utilizes Gavony Township to pump up its creatures, making them even more of a threat. The deck has some removal and control elements with cards like Mortarpod, Oblivion Ring, and Elspeth Tirel. Overall, the key concept of the deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and control the board.

The main concept of this deck is to establish a strong board presence quickly by playing efficient creatures such as Birds of Paradise, Blade Splicer, and Mirran Crusader. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with aggressive creatures like Hero of Bladehold and Geist-Honored Monk, while also utilizing cards like Mortarpod and Oblivion Ring for removal. The mana base is optimized for consistently casting creatures and activating Gavony Township. Planeswalkers like Elspeth Tirel, Gideon Jura, and Garruk Relentless provide additional threats and utility to help secure victories in a fast-paced, creature-focused game.

This deck focuses on quickly getting creatures on the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. Using mana ramp with Birds of Paradise and Avacyn's Pilgrim, the deck ramps up to play powerful creatures like Blade Splicer and Hero of Bladehold. Gavony Township and Elspeth Tirel help pump up the team for even stronger attacks. The deck also includes removal and token generation to control the battlefield. Overall, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain that pressure throughout the game.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with powerful Illusion creatures while utilizing cheap spells like Gut Shot and Mana Leak to control the board. Lord of the Unreal strengthens the Illusion creatures and enables powerful synergies with Phantasmal Image. The deck also includes Snapcaster Mage to recycle spells and maintain pressure on the opponent. By efficiently utilizing its resources and maintaining a high tempo, the deck aims to close out games quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive Illusion creatures while using spells like Vapor Snag and Dismember to control the board. Lord of the Unreal synergizes well with the Illusion creatures, making them stronger and harder to deal with. Snapcaster Mage provides flexibility by allowing spells to be reused from the graveyard. The deck also includes counter spells like Mana Leak to protect your creatures and disrupt your opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to quickly build a board presence and apply pressure to force the opponent into a defensive position.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence with Illusion creatures like Lord of the Unreal and Phantasmal Image, backed up by aggressive spells like Gut Shot and Dismember. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with early creature aggression and disruption using counterspells like Mana Leak. The deck also includes card draw and selection with Ponder and Gitaxian Probe to ensure consistent draws and keeping the pressure on the opponent. With efficient creatures and disruptive spells, this deck looks to quickly close out games before opponents can stabilize.

This deck focuses on using Illusion creatures and spells to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By utilizing creatures like Phantasmal Bear, Delver of Secrets, and Lord of the Unreal, along with counter spells like Mana Leak and removal spells like Dismember and Vapor Snag, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent while maintaining control of the board. The inclusion of cards like Snapcaster Mage and Phantasmal Image allow for flexibility and adaptability in different situations. Additionally, the deck features card draw and selection with Gitaxian Probe and Ponder to ensure consistency in drawing the necessary pieces to secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with aggressive Illusion creatures like Phantasmal Bear and Lord of the Unreal. By using cards like Snapcaster Mage and Phantasmal Image to replicate powerful spells and creatures, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can react. Cheap removal spells like Gut Shot and Vapor Snag help to control the opponent's board while countermagic in the form of Mana Leak and disruption from cards like Gitaxian Probe allow for protection and tempo advantage. Moorland Haunt provides a late-game threat with its ability to generate flying Spirits.

The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive Illusion creatures such as Phantasmal Bear and Lord of the Unreal. It also utilizes powerful spells like Mana Leak and Snapcaster Mage to control the board and protect its creatures. The inclusion of efficient removal spells like Dismember and Vapor Snag helps to keep the opponent's threats at bay while maintaining tempo. The deck's ability to generate card advantage through Gitaxian Probe and Ponder, along with the option to generate additional threats with Moorland Haunt, allows for a consistent and potent aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and utilizing powerful creatures like Primeval Titan and Inferno Titan to control the board. It includes cards like Solemn Simulacrum and Green Sun's Zenith for consistency and card advantage, as well as removal spells like Slagstorm and Arc Trail. The deck also has access to planeswalkers like Garruk Relentless and Garruk, Primal Hunter for additional threats and card advantage. The mana base is designed to support both green and red spells, with Kessig Wolf Run providing a potential win condition with buffed creatures.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through ramping up mana, utilizing creatures like Solemn Simulacrum and Birds of Paradise to accelerate into powerful threats like Primeval Titan and Wurmcoil Engine. It also includes removal like Day of Judgment and Beast Within to deal with opposing threats. The deck also has a strong top end with cards like Elesh Norn and Thrun, the Last Troll to close out the game. The inclusion of Kessig Wolf Run provides additional reach and potential for game-ending damage. The deck aims to out-value and out-maneuver opponents through its control elements and powerful threats.

The main concept of this deck is to establish early board control using mana accelerants like Birds of Paradise and Llanowar Elves, while ramping into powerful threats like Primeval Titan and Wurmcoil Engine. The deck also features removal and utility cards like Arc Trail and Acidic Slime to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Kessig Wolf Run allows for additional reach and the ability to finish off opponents quickly. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the pace of the game and overwhelming the opponent with big threats.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble equipment onto creatures, with Puresteel Paladin being a key card for card draw and cost reduction. The deck focuses on aggression, using efficient beaters like Invisible Stalker and Mirran Crusader. The equipment package, including Swords and Mortarpods, provides additional abilities and removal options. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast, versatile threats and capitalize on the synergy between equipment and creatures. With a mix of evasion, protection, and card advantage, this deck is built to maintain pressure and close out games swiftly.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By efficiently using cheap spells and creatures, the deck aims to deal damage as fast as possible and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. With a focus on direct damage and efficient creatures, the deck looks to apply constant pressure and force the opponent to react defensively. The burn spells and creatures with haste help maintain a fast pace and prevent the opponent from gaining control of the game.

The main idea behind this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using low-cost, high-impact creatures and burn spells. By quickly deploying creatures like Stormblood Berserker and Stromkirk Noble, along with efficient removal spells like Incinerate and Brimstone Volley, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and finish off the opponent before they can stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Shrine of Burning Rage and Chandra's Phoenix provides additional reach and inevitability to close out the game.

The main concept of this Red Deck Wins aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient creatures and burn spells. It aims to apply early pressure on the opponent while controlling the board with removal spells like Incinerate and Gut Shot. The deck focuses on dealing damage quickly and efficiently, utilizing cards like Shrine of Burning Rage and Chandra's Phoenix to maintain a steady stream of damage and close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells in order to quickly reduce their life total to zero. With cards like Grim Lavamancer, Reckless Waif, and Brimstone Volley, the deck aims to put constant pressure on the opponent while utilizing cards like Shrine of Burning Rage to close out the game. The inclusion of cards like Chandra's Phoenix and Koth of the Hammer adds additional versatility and staying power to the overall strategy. Overall, the deck is designed to be fast, efficient, and relentless in its pursuit of victory.

The main focus of this deck is to strategically play aggressive creatures and deal direct damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. Utilizing low-cost creatures like Stormblood Berserker and Stromkirk Noble combined with burn spells such as Incinerate and Brimstone Volley, the goal is to deplete the opponent's life total rapidly. The inclusion of Shrine of Burning Rage provides a continuous source of incremental damage, while cards like Grim Lavamancer and Chandra's Phoenix offer additional versatility and resilience in maintaining board presence and pressure. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with relentless aggression and efficient damage output.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using aggressive creatures and burn spells. By utilizing low-cost creatures like Goblin Arsonist and Stromkirk Noble, along with direct damage spells like Incinerate and Brimstone Volley, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of Shrine of Burning Rage and Koth of the Hammer provides additional ways to increase damage output and close out the game.  The strategy of this deck is to be fast and relentless, putting pressure on the opponent from the very beginning.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the board with low-cost White creatures and buffing them with Honor of the Pure and Angelic Destiny, while protecting them with Grand Abolisher and Gideon's Lawkeeper. The aggressive strategy is further boosted by including powerful creatures like Hero of Bladehold, Mirran Crusader, and Geist of Saint Traft, along with disruption from Mana Leak and Oblivion Ring. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of aggressive creatures and efficient control spells.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. It aims to slow down the opponent's strategy by countering key spells, removing threats from the board, and drawing cards to maintain resources. The win condition comes from either overwhelming the opponent with card advantage and powerful creatures like Consecrated Sphinx or Elesh Norn, or by creating a large number of tokens with White Sun's Zenith. The deck's mana base is designed to support a wide range of spells and ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and board wipes. The deck aims to stall the opponent's threats with cards like Mana Leak and Doom Blade, while also generating card advantage through spells like Forbidden Alchemy. Win conditions include powerful creatures like Wurmcoil Engine and Sun Titan, which can quickly take over the game once the opponent's threats are neutralized. The deck also includes options for graveyard recursion with cards like Unburial Rites, providing additional value and resilience.

This deck focuses on playing low-cost artifact creatures and utilizing Tempered Steel to boost their power and toughness. By quickly getting creatures on the board and increasing their stats with Tempered Steel, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive threats. Dispatch and Mikaeus, the Lunarch provide additional support and removal options, while Inkmoth Nexus can provide an alternate win condition. The deck's mana base is designed to support the aggro strategy, with a mix of Plains, Seachrome Coast, and Moorland Haunt.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through various means such as removal spells like Doom Blade and Black Sun's Zenith, along with disruptive cards like Despise and Mana Leak. The deck also includes powerful threats like Wurmcoil Engine and Consecrated Sphinx to help close out games. The inclusion of Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas and Liliana of the Veil provides additional value and card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, control the board, and win through powerful threats and planeswalker abilities.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. Snapcaster Mage allows for flexibility in spellcasting, while Consecrated Sphinx provides card draw. Midnight Haunting can generate blockers or attackers. Spells like Negate, Mana Leak, and Dissipate help control the opponent's plays. Sword of Feast and Famine can provide additional advantage by untapping lands. Day of Judgment acts as a board wipe, while Oblivion Ring handles problematic permanents. The mana base is balanced between Islands, Plains, and dual lands, with utility lands like Ghost Quarter and Moorland Haunt. Gideon Jura serves as a finisher or protection option.

This deck revolves around maximizing the synergy between Grand Architect and powerful artifact creatures. By using cards like Myr Superion and Wurmcoil Engine alongside Grand Architect's ability to generate mana, the deck aims to quickly establish board control and overwhelm opponents. Additional support comes from cards like Solemn Simulacrum and Phyrexian Metamorph for value generation. The inclusion of cards like Contagion Engine and Mindslaver provide disruption and control options, while cards like Treasure Mage and Prototype Portal offer consistency and flexibility in searching for key pieces.

The deck focuses on using a variety of control spells and creatures to manipulate the board state and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and card draw, the deck aims to control the game until it can efficiently play its powerful finishers like Grave Titan, Elesh Norn, and Consecrated Sphinx. The deck also includes cards like Unburial Rites to reanimate key threats from the graveyard. With a mix of removal, disruption, and strong creatures, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a longer game.
